value.title: Modify DAX filter context in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you’ll be able to describe filter context, which is used to evaluate measure formulas. You’ll then learn why some calculations need to modify filter context and that it can be achieved by using the CALCULATE function. Additionally, you’ll learn how to configure the CALCULATE function with filters and filter modifiers.

value.title: #33 Import from PDF into Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: In today's video I will show you how to import data from a pdf file into Power BI using Imke Feldmann's R-script. value.title: Introducing Performance Analyzer in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Performance Analyzer is the first diagnostic tool to find the slower parts of a report. Find the slowest DAX query before starting a deeper investigation using DAX Studio. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: The Best Way to Install Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Power BI Desktop is a free, standalone self service BI tool for data modelling and reporting.  You will not get a better, free desktop data modelling and reporting tool than this anywhere.   Power BI Desktop is evolving at a rapid rate with updates released every month. Due to the [...]Read More »

value.title: The Most Important Update to Power BI Desktop, Ever!
value.excerpt: The December 2020 version of Power BI desktop has just been released, and it is undoubtably the most important release since the first version way back in 2015. The super feature that has been released is an update to composite models using direct query of online datasets. The implications of [...]Read
